description: '''Allen Richard Toussaint''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|t|uː|s|ɑː|n|t}}; January 14, 1938 – November 10, 2015) was an American musician, songwriter, arranger, and record producer. He was an influential figure in [[New Orleans rhythm and blues]] from the 1950s to the end of the century, described as "one of popular music's great backroom figures." Many musicians recorded Toussaint's compositions. He was a producer for hundreds of recordings: the best known are "[[Right Place, Wrong Time (song)|Right Place, Wrong Time]]", by longtime friend [[Dr. John]], and "[[Lady Marmalade]]" by [[Labelle]].
